source_sentence: 爾時，彼惡龍吐舌，舐如來手，熟視如來面。
translation: At the time, that bad dragon spit out its tongue, licked the Tathāgata's hand, and looked at the Tathāgata's face.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊明日清旦，手擎此惡龍，往詣迦葉，語迦葉曰：「此是惡龍，
translation: The next morning, at dawn, the World-honored One lifted this evil dragon in his hand and approached Kasyapa.

source_sentence: 極為兇暴，今以降之。」
translation: It's extremely fierce, and now I'll follow it.

source_sentence: 爾時，迦葉見惡龍已，便懷恐怖，白世尊曰：「止！
translation: Seeing the bad dragon, Kāśyapa became frightened and said to the Bhagavān, Stop!

source_sentence: 止！
translation: Don't!

source_sentence: 沙門！
translation: Sramanaries!

source_sentence: 勿復來前，龍備相害。」
translation: Don't come before me again; the dragons will harm each other.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「迦葉！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 勿懼，我今已降之，終不相害。
translation: Don't be afraid, for now that I've subdued them, they won't harm each other.

source_sentence: 所以然者，此龍已受教化。」
translation: That's because this dragon has already been taught.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉及五百弟子歎未曾有：「甚奇！
translation: At that point, Kāśyapa and his five hundred disciples praised this unprecedented thing, saying, Marvelous!

source_sentence: 甚特！
translation: That's extraordinary!

source_sentence: 此瞿曇沙門極大威神，能降此惡龍，使不作惡；
translation: This śramaṇa Gautama’s supernatural power is so great that it can subdue these evil dragons and prevent them from doing evil.

source_sentence: 雖爾，故不如我得道真。」
translation: Even so, it's not like me attaining the truth of the path.

source_sentence: 爾時，迦葉白世尊曰：「大沙門！
translation: It was then that Kāśyapa said to the Bhagavān, Great ascetic!

source_sentence: 當受我九十日請，所須衣被、飯食、床臥具、病瘦醫藥，盡當供給。」
translation: You will accept my invitation for ninety days, and whatever you need clothing, bedding, food, beds, bedding, and medicine for illness and thinness will be provided in full.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊默然受迦葉請。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān remained silent and accepted Kāśyapa's invitation.

source_sentence: 時，世尊以此神龍著大海中，而彼惡龍隨壽長短，命終之後，生四天王天上。
translation: The Bhagavān then put this divine dragon into the ocean, and that bad dragon was born in the heaven of the four heavenly kings after its life span ended.

source_sentence: 是時，如來還止石室。
translation: The Tathāgata then returned to stay in the stone chamber.

source_sentence: 迦葉供辦種種飯食已，往白世尊：「飯食已辦，可往就食。」
translation: After he had prepared various kinds of food, Kāśyapa went to the Bhagavān and said, The food has been prepared, so you can go and eat it.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「迦葉在前，吾正爾當往。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Kāśyapa is here, and I'll go there right now.

source_sentence: 迦葉去後，便往至閻浮提界上，閻浮樹下取閻浮果。
translation: After leaving, Kāśyapa went up to the Jambudvīpa realm and picked Jambudvīpa fruit under a Jambudvīpa tree.

source_sentence: 還，先至迦葉石室中坐。
translation: When he returned, he first went to Kāśyapa's stone chamber and sat there.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉見世尊在石室中，白世尊曰：「沙門！
translation: When Kāśyapa saw the Bhagavān in the stone chamber, he said to the Bhagavān, Ascetic!

source_sentence: 為從何道，來至石室？」
translation: Where did you come from to the stone chamber?

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「汝去之後，吾至閻浮提界上，取閻浮果，還來至此坐。
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, After you leave, I'll go up to the limits of Jambudvīpa and take the Jambudvīpa fruit and return here to my seat.

source_sentence: 迦葉當知，此果甚為香美，可取食之。」
translation: Kāśyapa, you should know that this fruit is so fragrant and delicious that you can take it and eat it.

source_sentence: 迦葉對曰：「我不須是。
translation: Kāśyapa replied, I don't need it.

source_sentence: 沙門自取食之。」
translation: The ascetic takes it for himself and eats it.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉復作是念：「此沙門極有神足，有大威力，乃能至閻浮界上，
translation: Then Kāśyapa thought: This śramaṇa is endowed with supernormal powers and great might, so he can go up to Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 取此美果。
translation: Take this delicious fruit.

source_sentence: 雖爾，故不如我道真。」
translation: Even so, it's not like the truth of my path.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊食已，還在彼止宿。
translation: After he had eaten, the Bhagavān stayed overnight at that place.

source_sentence: 迦葉清朝至世尊所，到已，白世尊曰：「食時以至，可往就食。」
translation: Kāśyapa went to the Bhagavān in the clear morning and arrived there. When he arrived, he said to the Bhagavān, At the time of your arrival, you can go and eat.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「汝並在前，吾後當往。」
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, You're both here, and I'll go there later.

source_sentence: 迦葉去後，便至閻浮界上，取阿摩勒果。
translation: After leaving, Kāśyapa went up to the Jambudvīpa realm and collected the amala fruit.

source_sentence: 還，先至迦葉石室中坐。
translation: When he returned, he first went to Kāśyapa's stone chamber and sat there.

source_sentence: 迦葉白世尊曰：「沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa said to the Bhagavān, Ascetic!

source_sentence: 為從何道，來至此間？」
translation: Where did you come from and where did you come here?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「汝去之後，至閻浮界上，取此果來，極為香美。
translation: The World-honored One said to the bhikṣus: “After your departure, go up to Jambudvfpa and bring me this fruit that is extremely fragrant.

source_sentence: 若須者便取食之。」
translation: If you need it, then take it and eat it.

source_sentence: 迦葉對曰：「吾不須是，沙門自取食之。」
translation: Kāśyapa replied, I don't need this; the ascetic takes it for himself and eats it.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉復作是念：「此沙門極有神力，有大威神，吾去之後，取此果來。
translation: Kāśyapa then had another thought: This śramaṇa is endowed with supernormal powers and great authority. After my departure, I will bring this fruit to you.

source_sentence: 雖爾，故不如我，我已得道。」
translation: Even so, it's not like me; I've already attained the path.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊食已，還彼止宿。
translation: After he had eaten, the Bhagavān returned to that place to spend the night.

source_sentence: 明日，迦葉至世尊所，而作是說：「食時已至，可往就食。」
translation: On the next day, Kāśyapa went to the Bhagavān and said, The time has come for you to go and eat.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「汝並在前，吾後當往。」
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, You're both here, and I'll go there later.

source_sentence: 迦葉去後，世尊至北欝單曰，取自然粳米來，還至迦葉石室。
translation: After Kāśyapa’s departure, the World-honored One came to Uttarakuru in the northern direction. He said, “Taking rice that comes naturally from the land, I am returning to my stone chamber at Kāśyapa’s quarters.” Having departed, the World-honored One approached him and said:

source_sentence: 迦葉問佛：「沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa asked the Buddha, Ascetic!

source_sentence: 為從何道，來至此坐？」
translation: Where did you come from to sit here?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「迦葉當知，汝去之後，吾至欝單曰，取自然粳米，極為香好。
translation: The World-honored One said, “O Kāśyapa! You should know that after your departure I will go to Uttarakuru to collect uncooked millet of natural origin, which is extremely fragrant and good.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 須者便取食之。」
translation: Those who need it will then take it and eat it.

source_sentence: 迦葉對曰：「吾不須是。
translation: Kāśyapa replied, I don't need it.

source_sentence: 沙門自取食之。」
translation: The ascetic takes it for himself and eats it.

source_sentence: 迦葉復作是念：「此沙門極有神足，有大神力。
translation: Kāśyapa then had another thought, This ascetic has supernormal abilities and great supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 雖爾，故不如我得道真。」
translation: Even so, it's not like me attaining the truth of the path.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊食已，還彼止宿。
translation: After he had eaten, the Bhagavān returned to that place to spend the night.

source_sentence: 明日，迦葉至世尊所，而作是說：「食時已至，可往就食。」
translation: On the next day, Kāśyapa went to the Bhagavān and said, The time has come for you to go and eat.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「汝並在前，吾後當往。」
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, You're both here, and I'll go there later.

source_sentence: 迦葉去後，世尊至瞿耶尼，取呵梨勒果，先至迦葉石室中坐。
translation: After Kāśyapa’s departure, the World-honored One arrived at Goyānī to obtain some ālīputra fruits. He came first and sat down in Kāśyapa’s stone chamber.

source_sentence: 迦葉問佛：「沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa asked the Buddha, Ascetic!

source_sentence: 為從何道，來至此坐？」
translation: Where did you come from to sit here?

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「汝去之後，吾至瞿耶尼，取此果來，極為香美。
translation: The Buddha said to Kāśyapa: “After your departure, I will go to Aparagodānīya to obtain some of this fruit, which is extremely fragrant and delicate.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 須者可取食之。」
translation: Those who need it can take it and eat it.

source_sentence: 迦葉對曰：「不須是。
translation: Kāśyapa replied, It doesn't need to be so.

source_sentence: 沙門自取食之。」
translation: The ascetic takes it for himself and eats it.

source_sentence: 迦葉復作是念：「此沙門極有神力，有大威神。
translation: Kāśyapa then had another thought, This ascetic has great supernormal powers and great authority.

source_sentence: 雖爾，故不如我得道真。」
translation: Even so, it's not like me attaining the truth of the path.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊食已，還彼止宿。
translation: After he had eaten, the Bhagavān returned to that place to spend the night.

source_sentence: 明日，迦葉至世尊所而白：「時至，可往就食。」
translation: On the next day, Kāśyapa went to the Bhagavān and said, When the time comes, you can go and eat.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「汝並在前，吾後當往。」
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, You're both here, and I'll go there later.

source_sentence: 迦葉去後，世尊至弗于逮，取毘醯勒果，先至迦葉石室中坐。
translation: After Kāśyapa’s departure, the World-honored One came to Pūrvavideha. He took some grapes and went first to Kāśyapa’s stone chamber to take his seat.

source_sentence: 迦葉問佛：「沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa asked the Buddha, Ascetic!

source_sentence: 為從何道，來至此坐？」
translation: Where did you come from to sit here?

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「汝去之後，吾至弗于逮，取此果來，極為香好。
translation: The Buddha said to Kāśyapa: After your departure, I will go to Pūrvavideha to obtain this fruit, which is extremely fragrant and good.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 須者可取食之。」
translation: Those who need it can take it and eat it.

source_sentence: 迦葉對曰：「吾不須是，沙門自取食之。」
translation: Kāśyapa replied, I don't need this; the ascetic takes it for himself and eats it.

source_sentence: 迦葉復作是念：「此沙門極有神力，有大神足。
translation: Kāśyapa then had another thought, This ascetic has great supernormal powers and great supernormal abilities.

source_sentence: 雖爾，故不如我得道真。」
translation: Even so, it's not like me attaining the truth of the path.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊食已，還彼止宿。
translation: After he had eaten, the Bhagavān returned to that place to spend the night.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉時欲大祠，五百弟子執斧破薪，手擎斧而斧不下。
translation: At the time, Kāśyapa wanted a great sacrifice, and his five hundred disciples held an axe to break through the firewood, lifted an axe in their hands, and didn't let the axe down.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉復作是念：「此必沙門所為。」
translation: At that point, Kāśyapa again thought, This must be what the ascetic does.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉問世尊曰：「今欲破薪，斧何故不下也？」
translation: Kāśyapa then asked the Bhagavān, Now that you want to break down a piece of wood, why doesn't the axe go down?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「欲得斧下耶？」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Do you want to get the axe down?

source_sentence: 曰：「欲使下。」
translation: He said, I want to send it down.

source_sentence: 斧尋時下。
translation: It's below the time when the axe is searched.

source_sentence: 是時，彼斧既下，復不得舉。
translation: When the axe fell down, he couldn't lift it again.

source_sentence: 迦葉復白佛言：「斧何故不舉？」
translation: Kāśyapa again said to the Buddha, Why doesn't the axe lift?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「欲使斧舉耶？」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Do you want to make the axe lift?

source_sentence: 曰：「欲使舉。」
translation: He said, I want to cause it to be raised.

source_sentence: 斧尋得舉。
translation: The axe searched for it and lifted it.

source_sentence: 爾時，迦葉弟子意欲然火，火不得然。
translation: At the time, Kāśyapa's disciple wanted to light a fire in his mind, but the fire couldn't.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉復作是念：「此必沙門瞿曇所為。」
translation: Kāśyapa then again thought, This must be what the ascetic Gautama did.

source_sentence: 迦葉白佛：「火何故不然？」
translation: Kāśyapa said to the Buddha, Why isn't the fire?

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「欲使火然耶？」
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, Do you want to make the fire go out?

source_sentence: 曰：「欲使然。」
translation: He said, I want to make it so.

source_sentence: 火尋時然。
translation: It's the right time for the fire to search.

source_sentence: 爾時，意欲滅火，火復不滅。
translation: At that point, his mind wants to extinguish the fire, but the fire doesn't go out.

source_sentence: 迦葉白佛：「火何故不滅？」
translation: Kāśyapa said to the Buddha, Why doesn't the fire go out?

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「欲使火滅耶？」
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, Do you want to make the fire go out?

source_sentence: 曰：「欲使滅。」
translation: He said, I want to cause it to cease.

source_sentence: 火尋時滅。
translation: The fire goes out when it's searched.

source_sentence: 迦葉便作是念：「此沙門瞿曇，面目端政，世之希有。
translation: Kāśyapa thought: This renunciant Gotama is endowed with a handsome countenance rarely seen in the world.

source_sentence: 吾明日欲大祠，國王人民盡當來集，設當見此沙門者，吾不復得供養。
translation: On the morrow I wish to make a great sacrifice. All the kings and people of my country will assemble here. If they see this śramaṇa, I will no longer be able to support him.

source_sentence: 此沙門明日不來者，便為大幸。」
translation: If this ascetic doesn't come tomorrow, he'll be greatly fortunate.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊知迦葉心中所念：明日清旦，至欝單曰，取自然粳米，瞿耶尼取乳汁，
translation: Knowing what Kāśyapa thought in his mind, the World-honored One went to Uttarakuru on the morning of the following day at dawn to collect uncooked rice and milk juice.

source_sentence: 往至阿耨達泉而食。
translation: He went to Anavatapta's Spring and ate.

source_sentence: 竟日在彼住，向暮還至石室止宿。
translation: On the last day of the month he stayed there. In the evening he returned to his stone chamber and spent the night there.

source_sentence: 迦葉明日至世尊所，問曰：「沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa went to the Bhagavān in the morning and asked, Ascetic!

source_sentence: 昨日何故不來？」
translation: Why didn't you come yesterday?

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「汝昨日作是念：『此瞿曇極為端政，世之希有。
translation: The Buddha said to Kāśyapa: Yesterday you had this thought: This Gautama is extremely handsome and rare in the world.

source_sentence: 吾明日大祠，若國王人民見者，便斷吾供養。
translation: If the king and his people see it, they will cut off my offerings.

source_sentence: 設不來者，便是大幸。』
translation: If someone doesn't come, it's a great blessing.'

source_sentence: 我尋知汝心之所念，乃至欝單曰，取自然粳米，瞿耶尼取乳汁，往阿耨達泉上食。
translation: I'll know what you think about it, even if you go to Uttarakuru and take natural millet, and Goyaṇī takes the juice of milk and goes up to the Anavatapta fountain to eat it.

source_sentence: 竟日在彼，向暮還至石室中止宿。」
translation: On the evening after the day, he returned to the stone chamber and stayed overnight there.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉復作是念：「此大沙門，極有神足，實有威神。
translation: Kāśyapa then had another thought: This great śramaṇa possesses supernormal powers and is indeed endowed with authority.

source_sentence: 雖爾，故不如我得道真。」
translation: Even so, it's not like me attaining the truth of the path.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊食已，還石室止宿。
translation: After he had eaten, the Bhagavān returned to his cave and spent the night there.

source_sentence: 即夜，四天王至世尊所而聽經法，四天王亦有光明，佛亦大放光，照彼山野，
translation: That night, the four guardian gods of heaven came to the place where the World-honored One was and listened to the discourse. The four guardian gods also had a ray of light. The Buddha also issued a great ray of light that shone brightly over the mountains and fields.

source_sentence: 洞然一色。
translation: It's a single color in the cave.

source_sentence: 時，彼迦葉夜見光明。
translation: That Kāśyapa then saw a bright light at night.

source_sentence: 明日清旦，至世尊所，到已，白世尊曰：「昨夜是何光明照此山野？」
translation: On the morning, at dawn, he arrived at the Bhagavān's place. When he arrived, he said to the Bhagavān, What kind of light did you shine in this mountain and field last night?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「昨夜四天王來至我所而聽法，是彼四天王之光明。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Yesterday night, the four heavenly kings came to me and listened to the teaching, which is the light of those four heavenly kings.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉復作是念：「此沙門極有神力，乃能使四天王來聽經法。
translation: Kāśyapa then had another thought, This ascetic has such supernormal powers that he can cause the four heavenly kings to come and listen to the sūtras and teachings.

source_sentence: 雖有此力，由不如我得道真。」
translation: Even though they have this power, it's because they aren't like me that they attain the true nature of the path.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊食已，還在彼宿。
translation: After he had eaten, the Bhagavān was still there that night.

source_sentence: 夜半，釋提桓因來至世尊所而聽法，天帝光明復照彼山。
translation: At midnight, Śakra Devānām-Indra came to the Bhagavān's place and listened to the teaching, and Indra again shone brightly on that mountain.

source_sentence: 時，彼迦葉夜起瞻星，見此光明。
translation: That Kāśyapa then rose in the night to look up at the stars and saw this light.

source_sentence: 明日清旦，迦葉至世尊所，問曰：「瞿曇！
translation: On the morning, at dawn, Kāśyapa went to the Bhagavān and asked, Gautama!

source_sentence: 昨夜光明極為殊特，有何因緣，有此光明？」
translation: Yesterday night's light was extraordinary, so what is the reason for this light?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「昨夜天帝釋來至此聽經，故有此光明耳。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Yesterday night, Indra came here to listen to the sūtras, so there's this light.

source_sentence: 時，迦葉復作是念：「此沙門瞿曇極有神力，有大威神，乃能使天帝釋來聽經法。
translation: Kāśyapa then had another thought: This renunciant Gotama possesses supernatural powers and great authority, which enable him to summon Sakka (i.e., Indra), lord of the gods, to come and listen to the teaching of the sutra.

source_sentence: 雖爾，故不如我得道真。」
translation: Even so, it's not like me attaining the truth of the path.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊食已，還在彼宿。
translation: After he had eaten, the Bhagavān was still there that night.

source_sentence: 夜半，梵天王放大光明照彼山中，至世尊所而聽經法。
translation: At midnight, the Brahmadeva king radiated a great ray of light that shone brightly on the mountain and went to the Bhagavān to listen to the sūtras and teachings.

source_sentence: 時，迦葉夜起見光明，明日至世尊所而問曰：「昨夜光明倍有所照，勝於日月光明，
translation: At night, Kāśyapa rose from his seat and saw a ray of light. In the morning he came to the place where the World-honored One was staying and asked:

source_sentence: 有何等因緣，致此光明？」
translation: What are the causes and conditions that bring about this light?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「迦葉當知，昨夜大梵天王來至我所而聽經法。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Kāśyapa, you should know that last night the great Brahma king came to me and listened to the sūtras and teachings.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉復作是念：「此沙門瞿曇極有神力，乃能使我祖父來至此沙門所而聽經法。
translation: Kāśyapa then had another thought, This ascetic Gautama has great supernormal powers that will allow my grandfather to come to this ascetic and listen to the sūtras and teachings.

source_sentence: 雖爾，故不如我得道真。」
translation: Even so, it's not like me attaining the truth of the path.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊得弊壞五納衣，意欲浣濯，便作是念：「我當於何處而浣此衣？」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān obtained the five tattered robes and wanted to wash them, so he thought, Where will I wash these robes?

source_sentence: 是時，釋提桓因知世尊心中所念，即化作浴池，白世尊曰：「可在此浣衣。」
translation: Knowing what the Bhagavān thought in his mind, Śakra Devānām-Indra transformed himself into a bathing pond and said to the Bhagavān, You can wash your clothes here.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊復作是念：「吾當於何處蹋浣此衣？」
translation: The Bhagavān then again thought, Where will I step on this robe and wash it?

source_sentence: 時，四天王知世尊心中所念，便舉大方石著水側，白世尊曰：「可在此而蹋衣。」
translation: Knowing what the Bhagavān was thinking in his mind, the four heavenly kings lifted a large stone to the side of the water and said to the Bhagavān, You can step on my robe here.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊復作是念：「吾何處而曝此衣？」
translation: The Bhagavān then again thought, Where will I expose this robe?

source_sentence: 時，樹神知世尊心中所念，便垂樹枝，白世尊曰：「唯願在此曝衣。」
translation: Knowing what the Bhagavān was thinking in his mind, the tree goddess then hung a branch of the tree and said to the Bhagavān, Please expose your robe here.

source_sentence: 明日清旦，迦葉至世尊所，問世尊曰：「本無此池，今有此池；
translation: On the morning, at dawn, Kāśyapa came to the place where the World-honored One was. He asked the World-honored One, “This pond did not exist in the past; now there is this pond.

source_sentence: 本無此樹，今有此樹；
translation: This tree did not exist in the past but now there is one.

source_sentence: 本無此石，今有此石。
translation: This stone did not exist in the past but is now in existence.

source_sentence: 有何因緣，而有此變？」
translation: What are the causes and conditions that make this change possible?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「此是昨夜天帝釋知吾欲浣衣，故作此浴池。
translation: The Bhagavān told him, This is the bathing pond built by Indra last night because he knew that I wanted to wash my clothes.

source_sentence: 吾復作是念：『當於何處蹋浣此衣？』
translation: Again, I thought, 'Where will I steal this robe?'

source_sentence: 時四天王知吾心中所念，便持此石來。
translation: Knowing what I thought in my mind, the four heavenly kings then brought this stone to me.

source_sentence: 吾復作是念：『當於何處而曝此衣？』
translation: Again, I thought, 'Where will this robe be exposed?'

source_sentence: 時樹神知我心中所念，便垂此樹枝耳。」
translation: Knowing what I thought in my mind, the tree god then hung down a branch of this tree for my ears.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉復作是念：「此沙門瞿曇雖神，故不如我得道真。」
translation: Kāśyapa then again thought, Although this ascetic Gautama is a god, he's not as good as me in attaining the truth of the path.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊食已，還於彼宿。
translation: After he had eaten, the Bhagavān returned to that lunar station.

source_sentence: 是時，夜半有大黑雲起而作大雨，連若大河，極為瀑溢。
translation: At midnight the great black clouds rose and showered down a great deal of rain, which was as continuous as a large river that overflowed with water.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉復作是念：「此河瀑溢，沙門必當為水所漂，我今看之。」
translation: At the time, Kāśyapa again thought, This river is overflowing, and the ascetic will surely be floating in the water; now I'll look at it.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉及五百弟子往至河所，爾時世尊在水上行，脚不為水所漬。
translation: Kāśyapa and his five hundred disciples then went to the river, where the Bhagavān was walking on water with his feet not submerged in water.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉遙見世尊在水上行。
translation: Kāśyapa then saw the Bhagavān walking up in the water from a distance.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉便作是念：「甚奇！
translation: Kāśyapa then had this thought, How marvelous!

source_sentence: 甚特！
translation: That's extraordinary!

source_sentence: 沙門瞿曇乃能在水上行，我亦能在水上行，但不能使脚不污耳。
translation: The śramaṇa Gautama is able to walk on water. I am also able to walk on water, but I cannot keep my feet from dirtying them.

source_sentence: 此沙門雖神，故不如我得道真。」
translation: Although this ascetic is a god, he's not like me who has attained the truth of the path.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊語迦葉言：「汝亦非阿羅漢，復不知阿羅漢道，汝尚不識阿羅漢名，
translation: The World-honored One said to Kāśyapa: You are not an arhat, you do not know the path of an arhat, and you do not know the name of an arhat.

source_sentence: 況得道乎？
translation: How could it be possible to attain the Way?

source_sentence: 汝是盲人，目無所覩，如來現爾許變化，故言：『不如我得道真。』
translation: You're a blind man whose eyes don't see anything, and the Tathāgata shows such transformations, so he says, 'It's not as good as me attaining the truth of the path.'

source_sentence: 汝方作是語：『吾能在水上行。』
translation: You then say, 'I can walk on water.'

source_sentence: 今正是時，可共在水上行耶？
translation: Now is the right time, so can we walk together on the water?

source_sentence: 汝今可捨邪見之心，無令長夜受此苦惱。」
translation: Now, you must abandon the mind of wrong views and not allow yourself to suffer this kind of suffering for a long time.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉聞世尊語已，便前頭面禮足：「我今悔過，深知非法，乃觸如來，
translation: Having heard the words of the World-honored One, Kāśyapa bowed his forehead at his feet and said: I now repent. Knowing deeply that it is against the Dharma, I am touching the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 唯願受悔。」
translation: Please accept my repentance.

source_sentence: 如是再三。
translation: He repeated it three times like this.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「聽汝改過，乃能自知觸擾如來。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Listen to your correction, and you'll be able to know for yourself that you're touching the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉告五百弟子曰：「汝等各隨所宜，我今自歸沙門瞿曇。」
translation: Kāśyapa then addressed the five hundred disciples, Each of you according to your abilities, and now I take refuge in the ascetic Gautama.

source_sentence: 是時，五百弟子白迦葉言：「我等先亦有心於沙門瞿曇，當降龍時，尋欲歸命。
translation: The five hundred disciples then said to Kāśyapa, “Earlier we also had the thought of taking refuge in the śramaṇa Gautama.

source_sentence: 若師自歸瞿曇者，我等五百弟子盡自歸於瞿曇所。」
translation: If the teacher returns to Gautama for himself, all of our five hundred disciples will return to Gautama for themselves.

source_sentence: 迦葉報言：「今正是時，然復我心執此愚癡，見爾許變化，意由不解，
translation: Kāśyapa replied, Now is the right time. But again, my mind clings to this foolishness and sees such magical transformations because I do not understand them.

source_sentence: 故自稱言：『我道真正。』」
translation: That's why they claim to say, 'My path is truly true.'

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉將五百弟子，前後圍繞，至世尊所，頭面禮足，在一面立，
translation: Then Kāśyapa, surrounded by the five hundred disciples, came before the World-honored One, bowed his forehead at his feet, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 白世尊曰：「唯願世尊聽我等得作沙門！
translation: They said to the Bhagavān, May the Bhagavān hear us become as monks!

source_sentence: 修清淨行。」
translation: He cultivates pure practices.

source_sentence: 諸佛常法。
translation: The buddhas are always the Dharma.

source_sentence: 若稱：「善來，比丘！」
translation: If he says, Well come, monk!

source_sentence: 便成沙門。
translation: He then became an ascetic.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊告迦葉曰：「善來，比丘！
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed Kāśyapa, Good, monk!

source_sentence: 此法微妙，善修梵行。」
translation: This teaching is subtle and well cultivates the religious practice.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉及五百弟子所著衣裳，盡變作袈裟，頭髮自落，如似剃髮，
translation: Then Kāśyapa and the five hundred disciples transformed their robes into reddish-brown robes with hair hanging down like a shave.

source_sentence: 以經七日。
translation: It took seven days.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉學術之具及於呪術，盡投水中。
translation: At the time, Kāśyapa had thrown all his teachings and spells into the water.

source_sentence: 時，五百弟子白世尊曰：「唯願世尊聽我等得作沙門。」
translation: The five hundred disciples then said to the Bhagavān, May the Bhagavān hear us become as monks.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「善來，比丘！」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Welcome, monk!

source_sentence: 時，五百弟子即成沙門，袈裟著身，頭髮自落。
translation: The five hundred disciples then became śramaṇas, put their robes on their bodies and hair dropped off by themselves.

source_sentence: 爾時，順水下流，有梵志，名江迦葉，在水側住。
translation: At the time, there was a priest named Jiang Kāśyapa who went downstream and lived beside the water.

source_sentence: 是時，江迦葉見呪術之具，盡為水所漂，便作是念：「咄哉！
translation: Seeing all the spells, Jiang Kāśyapa was floating in the water and thought, Whoops!

source_sentence: 我大兄為水所溺？」
translation: My big brother is submerged in water?

source_sentence: 是時，江迦葉將三百弟子，順水上流，求兄屍骸。
translation: At the time, Jiang Kāśyapa and 300 of his disciples went upstream in the water to search for their brother's corpse.

source_sentence: 遙見世尊在一樹下坐，及大迦葉五百弟子前後圍繞而為說法。
translation: From a distance, he saw the Bhagavān sitting under a tree and Mahākāśyapa, surrounded by five hundred disciples in front and behind him, expounding the Dharma.

source_sentence: 見已，便前至迦葉所，而作是語：「此事為好耶？
translation: Seeing this, he went to Kāśyapa and said, Is this a good thing?

source_sentence: 本為人師，今為弟子。
translation: Formerly he was a teacher but now he is a disciple.

source_sentence: 大兄何故與沙門作弟子乎？」
translation: Why did big brother become a disciple of the ascetic?

source_sentence: 迦葉對曰：「此處為妙，無過此處。」
translation: Kāśyapa replied, This place is marvelous; there's nothing better than this place.

source_sentence: 「此師人天貴，　　我今師事之，
translation: This teacher is a man of divine value. I now serve him as his teacher.

source_sentence: 諸佛興出世，　　甚為難得遇。」
translation: The buddhas arise and appear in the world, which is very difficult to meet.

source_sentence: 是時，優毘迦葉向江迦葉而說此偈：是時，江迦葉聞佛名號，甚懷歡喜，
translation: At that time, the venerable Upekas spoke these verses to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti: The Licchavi Vimalakīrti heard the Buddha’s name and was greatly delighted.

source_sentence: 踊躍不能自勝，前白世尊：「願聽為道。」
translation: Unable to overcome themselves, he said to the Bhagavān, May I hear it for the sake of the path?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「善來，比丘！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Well come, monk!

source_sentence: 善修梵行，盡於苦際。」
translation: He well cultivates the religious practice and reaches the limit of suffering.

source_sentence: 是時，江迦葉及三百弟子即成沙門，袈裟著身，頭髮自落。
translation: At the time, Jiang Kāśyapa and 300 of his disciples then became as monks, put their robes on their bodies, and dropped their hair.

source_sentence: 是時，江迦葉及三百弟子呪術之具，盡投水中。
translation: At the time, Jiang Kāśyapa and 300 of his disciples had all thrown themselves into the water with their spells.

source_sentence: 爾時，順水下頭有梵志，名伽夷迦葉，在水側住。
translation: At the time, there was a priest named Gayā-Kāśyapa living by the water's side.

source_sentence: 遙見呪術之具，為水所漂，便作是念：「我有二兄，在上學道。
translation: Seeing the spell from a distance, he was floating in the water and thought to himself, “I have two brothers who are still learning the Way at Shang.

source_sentence: 今呪術之具，盡為水所漂，二大迦葉必為水所害。」
translation: Now, all the implements of the spell will be floated by the water, and the two great Kāśyapa will surely be harmed by the water.

source_sentence: 即將二百弟子，順水上流，乃至學術之處，遙見二兄而作沙門，便作是語：「此處好耶？
translation: The two hundred disciples then went up into the water and studied. Seeing their two brothers from a distance, they became śramaṇas. They said: Is this place good for you?

source_sentence: 本為人尊，今為沙門弟子。」
translation: Formerly he was honored as a person, but now he's a disciple of the ascetic.

source_sentence: 迦葉報曰：「此處最妙，無過此處。」
translation: Kāśyapa replied, This place is most wonderful; there's nothing better than this place.

source_sentence: 是時，伽夷迦葉便作是念：「今我二兄多知博學，此處必是善地，使我二兄在中學道，
translation: At that time, Gayā-Kāśyapa thought: Now, since my two brothers are well versed in learning, this place must be a good one for them.

source_sentence: 我今亦可在中學道。」
translation: Now, I can also follow the path of the middle way.

source_sentence: 是時，伽夷迦葉前白世尊：「唯願世尊聽作沙門。」
translation: Kāśyapa then went before the Bhagavān and said, Please, Bhagavān, let's hear you become a monk.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「善來，比丘！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Well come, monk!

source_sentence: 善修梵行，盡於苦際。」
translation: He well cultivates the religious practice and reaches the limit of suffering.

source_sentence: 是時，伽夷迦葉即成沙門，袈裟著身，頭髮自落，如似剃頭，以經七日。
translation: At the time, Kāśyapa then became a monk, put his robe on his body and dropped it himself, just as if he had shaved his hair for seven days.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊在彼河側住，尼拘類樹下，成佛未久，將千弟子，是皆耆舊宿長。
translation: At that time the World-honored One was staying at the riverside, under a tree named Nirgrantha. He had not long since become a buddha, with one thousand disciples, all of whom were elder monks and senior citizens.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊以三事教化。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān taught and transformed them in three ways.

source_sentence: 云何為三？
translation: What are these three?

source_sentence: 所謂神足教化，言教教化，訓誨教化。
translation: The so-called supernormal abilities teach and transform, which are verbally taught and transformed, and instructing and teaching.

source_sentence: 彼云何名為神足教化？
translation: What's called the teaching of miraculous abilities?

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊或作若干形，還合為一，或不現，或現。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān might take a certain shape and combine it into one, or he might not show it or show it.

source_sentence: 石壁皆過，無所罣礙，或出地，或入地，猶如流水，無所觸礙，或結跏趺坐，
translation: The stone walls all pass through without obstruction. They may come out of the earth or go into the earth, just as if they were flowing with water and do not encounter any obstruction. Some are sitting cross-legged.

source_sentence: 滿虛空中，如鳥飛空，無有罣礙。
translation: It fills space like a bird flying in the sky, with no obstruction.

source_sentence: 亦如大火山，烟出無量。
translation: It's also like a great volcanic fire that produces measureless smoke.

source_sentence: 此日月有大神力，不可限量，以手往捉，身乃至梵天。
translation: This sun and moon have great supernatural powers, which cannot be limited. They go out to grab the gods with their hands and reach as far as Brahmā Heaven.

source_sentence: 如是，世尊現神足。
translation: Thus, the Bhagavān manifested his miraculous powers.

source_sentence: 彼云何名為言教教化？
translation: What's called verbal instruction and teaching?

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊教諸比丘：「當捨是、置是。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān instructed the monks, You must abandon this and leave it here.

source_sentence: 當近是、遠是。
translation: What's near is what's near and what's far.

source_sentence: 當念是、去是。
translation: You should think, 'This is it,' and 'this is going to be it.'

source_sentence: 當觀是、不觀是。」
translation: You should observe it as right and not observe it as wrong.

source_sentence: 彼云何當修是、不修是者，當修七覺意，滅三結。
translation: How will they cultivate this and not cultivate that? They will cultivate the seven factors of enlightenment and extinguish the three fetters.

source_sentence: 彼云何當觀、當不觀者？
translation: How should they be observed and not observed?

source_sentence: 當觀三結、沙門善：所謂出要樂、無恚樂、無怒樂。
translation: You should observe three kinds of bonds and ascetic goodness: the so-called bliss that comes from renunciation, no bliss in anger, and no bliss in anger.

source_sentence: 彼云何不觀？
translation: How can they not contemplate?

source_sentence: 所謂三沙門苦。
translation: It's called the suffering of the three ascetics.

source_sentence: 云何為三？
translation: What are these three?

source_sentence: 所謂欲觀、恚觀、怒觀。
translation: It's called the contemplation of desire, the contemplation of anger, and the contemplation of anger.

source_sentence: 彼云何念、云何不念？
translation: How are they mindful and how are they not mindful?

source_sentence: 爾時，當念苦諦，當念習諦，當念盡諦，當念道諦；
translation: At that time, they should be mindful of the truth of suffering, of the truth of accumulation, of the truth of cessation, and of the truth of the path.

source_sentence: 莫念邪諦：有常見、無常見，有邊見、無邊見，彼命、彼身，非命、非身，
translation: Don’t think of the false truth: “There is common view and no common view. There is extreme view and no extreme view. That life and that body are neither life nor body.

source_sentence: 如來命終、如來不命終，有終、有不終，亦不有終、亦不無終。
translation: The Tathāgata's life ends and the Tathāgata doesn't end, and there's an end and a non-end, and there's no end and no end.

source_sentence: 莫作是念。
translation: Don't think like this.

source_sentence: 彼云何名為訓誨教化？
translation: What's called instruction and teaching?

source_sentence: 復次，當作是去、不應作是去，作是來、不應作是來，默然、作是言說：「當持如是衣、不應持如是衣，
translation: Again, the bhikṣu should make this departure and not make such a departure. The bhikṣu should make this coming and not make such a coming. He remains silent and says these words:

source_sentence: 應如是入村、不應如是入村。」
translation: You should enter the village like this and not enter the village like that.

source_sentence: 是謂名為訓誨教化。
translation: This is called instructing, teaching, and transforming.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊以此三事，教化千比丘。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān used these three things to teach a thousand monks.

source_sentence: 是時，彼比丘受佛教已，千比丘盡成阿羅漢。
translation: After that monk had received the Buddha's teaching, a thousand monks became arhats.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊以見千比丘得羅漢，爾時閻浮里地有千阿羅漢及五比丘，佛為六師，
translation: At that time the World-honored One saw that a thousand monks had attained arhatship. At that time in Jambudvlpa there were one thousand arhats and five monks, of whom the Buddha was the sixth:

source_sentence: 迴坐向迦毘羅衛。
translation: He returned to his seat and faced Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 是時，優毘迦葉便作是念：「世尊何故向迦毘羅衛坐？」
translation: Upikaśas then had this thought, Bhagavān, why is the Bhagavān sitting facing Kapilavastu?

source_sentence: 是時，優毘迦葉即前長跪，白世尊曰：「不審如來，何故向迦毘羅衛坐耶？」
translation: Upikaśyapa then knelt down in front of him and said to the Bhagavān, I wonder why the Tathāgata is sitting facing Kapilavastu?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「如來在世間，應行五事。
translation: The World-honored One said: While the Tathāgata resides in the world, he should perform five acts.

source_sentence: 云何為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一者當轉法輪，二者當與父說法，三者當與母說法，四者當導凡夫人立菩薩行，
translation: One, they will turn the wheel of the Dharma; two, they will teach the Dharma to their fathers; three, they will teach the Dharma to their mothers; and four, they will guide laymen in the practice of enlightening beings.

source_sentence: 五者當授菩薩別。
translation: The fifth is the distinction between the bodhisattvas who will be taught.

translation: When the Tathāgata appears in the world, he'll practice these five things.

source_sentence: 是時，優毘迦葉復作是念：「如來故念親族本邦，故向彼坐耳。」
translation: At the time, Upikāśyapa again had this thought, Because the Tathāgata is mindful of his relatives and native land, he's sitting there.

source_sentence: 是時，五比丘漸來至尼連水側，到世尊所，頭面禮足，在一面坐。
translation: The five bhikṣus then gradually came to the side of Nairañjāna’s river. Having approached the World-honored One, they bowed their foreheads and feet [to him] and took their seats at one side.

source_sentence: 是時，尊者優陀耶遙見世尊向迦毘羅衛坐，見已，便作是念：「世尊必當欲往至迦毘羅衛見諸親里。」
translation: At the time, Venerable Udayana saw the Bhagavān from a distance as he sat facing Kapilavastu and after seeing him, he thought, The Bhagavān will surely want to go to Kapilavastu to see his relatives.

source_sentence: 是時，優陀耶即前長跪，白世尊曰：「我今堪任欲有所問，唯願敷演。」
translation: Udayana then knelt down in front of him and said to the Bhagavān, Now, I'm competent to ask questions, but I'd like to explain them.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「欲所問者便問之。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, If you want to ask a question, ask it.

source_sentence: 優陀耶白世尊曰：「觀如來意，欲向迦毘羅衛。」
translation: Udayana said to the Bhagavān, Observe what the Tathāgata wants, and he wants to go to Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「如是，如汝所言。
translation: The Bhagavān told him, So it is, just as you say.

source_sentence: 優陀耶當知，先至白淨王所，吾比後當往。
translation: You should know, Udayana, that you'll first go to the white pure king's place, and I'll go there later.

source_sentence: 所以然者，剎利之種先當遣使令知，然後如來當往。
translation: The reason for this is that the kṣatriyas will first send messengers to let them know, and then the Tathāgata will go.

source_sentence: 汝到，語王：『却後七日，如來當來見王。』」
translation: Come and tell the king, 'Seven days from now, the Tathāgata will see the king in the future.'

source_sentence: 優陀耶對曰：「如是。
translation: Udāya replied, So it is.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是時，優陀耶即從坐起，整衣服，禮世尊足，於世尊前不現，往至迦毘羅衛，
translation: Then Sudarśana rose from his seat, straightened his clothes, saluted the World-honored One by bowing to his feet, and departed for Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 到真淨王所。
translation: He went to the true and pure king's place.

source_sentence: 到已，在王前立。
translation: When he arrived, he stood in front of the king.

source_sentence: 爾時，真淨王在大殿上坐，及諸婇女。
translation: At the time, the truly pure king was seated in the great hall and the court ladies.

source_sentence: 是時，優陀耶飛在空中。
translation: At the time, Udayana flew up into the air.

source_sentence: 時真淨王見優陀耶手執鉢，持杖而在前立，見已便懷恐怖，而作是說：「此是何人？
translation: Seeing that Udayana was holding a bowl in his hand and holding a staff in front of him, King Satyajit became frightened and said, Who is this person?

source_sentence: 人耶？
translation: Is a human being?

source_sentence: 非人耶？
translation: Is it not a human being?

source_sentence: 天耶？
translation: Are they gods?

source_sentence: 鬼耶？
translation: Is a ghost?

source_sentence: 閱叉、羅剎、天、龍、鬼神耶？」
translation: Yakṣa, Rāṣṭrapāla, gods, dragons, ghosts, and spirits?

source_sentence: 時，真淨王問優陀耶曰：「汝是何人？」
translation: King Zenshō then asked Udayana, Who are you?

source_sentence: 「為天為是鬼？　　乾沓惒等乎？
translation: Are they gods or ghosts, such as the gandharvas?

source_sentence: 汝今名為誰？　　我今欲知之？」
translation: To whom do you now belong?

source_sentence: 「我亦非是天，　　非是乾沓惒，
translation: I am neither a god nor a gandharva.

source_sentence: 於是迦毘國，　　大王邦土人。
translation: He came to the country of Kapilavastu, a kingdom belonging to the people.

source_sentence: 昔壞十八億，　　弊魔波旬眾，
translation: Formerly it had been destroyed by the evil Māra and the partisans, Eight billion years ago.

source_sentence: 我師釋迦文，　　是彼真弟子。」
translation: My teacher, Śākyamuni, is that true disciple.

source_sentence: 又以此偈向優陀耶說：是時，優陀耶復以此偈報王曰：時，真淨王復以此偈，
translation: Again, he spoke these verses to Udayana:

source_sentence: 「誰壞十八億，　　弊魔波旬眾？
translation: Who destroyed  1.8 billion of the harmful Mārapāpīyān people?

source_sentence: 誰字釋迦文？　　汝今歎說之。」
translation: Who is the Sanskrit word Śākyamuni?

source_sentence: 「如來初生時，　　天地普大動，
translation: When the Buddha was first born, All the heavens and earth trembled greatly.

source_sentence: 誓願悉成辦，　　今曰號悉達！
translation: Their vows are all accomplished, and now they're called Siddhârtha!

source_sentence: 彼降十八億，　　弊魔波旬眾，
translation: They subdued  1.8 billion, the harmful Māra-pāpīpīyān multitude.

source_sentence: 彼名釋迦文，　　今日成佛道！
translation: His name was Śākyamuni, and today he's accomplished the Buddha Way!

source_sentence: 彼人釋師子，　　瞿曇次弟子，
translation: That man, the Śākya lion, The next disciple of Gautama,

source_sentence: 今日作沙門，　　本字優陀耶！」
translation: Today, I'll become an ascetic, originally named Udayana!

source_sentence: 向優陀耶說：是時，優陀耶復說此偈：是時，真淨王聞此語已，便懷歡喜，
translation: At that moment, having heard these words, King Vimalakīrti was delighted.

source_sentence: 不能自勝，語優陀耶曰：「云何，優陀耶！
translation: Unable to overcome himself, he said to Udayana, What's the matter, Udayana?

translation: Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is

source_sentence: 優陀耶報言：「釋迦文佛今日現在。」
translation: Udayana replied, Śākyamuni Buddha is present today.

source_sentence: 時王問言：「今已成佛耶？」
translation: The king then asked, Has he become a buddha now?

source_sentence: 優陀耶報言：「今已成佛。」
translation: Udayana replied, Now I've become a buddha.

source_sentence: 王復問言：「今日如來竟為所在？」
translation: The king again asked, Where is the Tathāgata today?

source_sentence: 優陀耶報言：「如來今在摩竭國界尼拘類樹下。」
translation: Udayana replied, The Tathāgata is now under a tree of the nyagrodha tree at the border of the country of Magadha.

source_sentence: 時王報言：「翼從弟子斯是何人？」
translation: The king then replied, Who's this disciple who follows the wing?

source_sentence: 優陀耶報曰：「諸天億數及千比丘、四天王，恒在左右。」
translation: Udayana replied, Tens of millions of gods, a thousand monks, and the four heavenly kings are always at their sides.

source_sentence: 時王問言：「所著衣服，為像何類？」
translation: The king then asked, What kind of clothes are the images that you wear?

source_sentence: 優陀耶報言：「如來所著衣裳，名曰袈裟。」
translation: Udayana replied, The robe the Tathāgata wears is called a monk's robe.

source_sentence: 時王問言：「食何等食？」
translation: The king then asked, What kind of food does it eat?

source_sentence: 優陀耶報言：「如來身者，以法為食。」
translation: Udayana replied, The Tathāgata's body is based on the Dharma as food.

source_sentence: 王復問曰：「云何，優陀耶！
translation: The king again asked, What's the matter, Udayana?

source_sentence: 如來可得見不？」
translation: Can the Tathāgata be seen?

source_sentence: 優陀耶報言：「王勿愁悒，却後七日，如來當來入城。」
translation: Udayana replied, Don't worry, king; seven days from now, the Tathāgata will come into the city.

source_sentence: 是時，王極歡喜，不能自勝，手自斟酌，供養優陀耶。
translation: The king was greatly delighted, unable to control himself. He offered food and drink to Udayana with his palms joined together as an offering.

source_sentence: 是時，真淨王擊大鳴鼓，勅國界人民，平治道路，除去不淨，以香汁灑地，
translation: At that time King Zenshō sounded a loud drum and ordered the people of his kingdom to level the roads, sweeping away what was unclean and sprinkling the ground with scented juice.

source_sentence: 懸繒幡蓋，作倡伎樂，不可稱計。
translation: They hang silken banners and canopies, playing music that cannot be measured or counted.

source_sentence: 復勅國中諸有聾、盲、瘖、瘂者，盡使不現，却後七日，悉達當來入城。
translation: Again, the emperor ordered all the deaf, blind, dumb, and dumb people in his kingdom not to show up. Seven days later, Siddhārtha would enter the city.

source_sentence: 是時，真淨王聞佛當來入城，七日之中，亦不睡眠。
translation: At the time, King Śubhavyūha heard that the Buddha was about to enter the city, and for seven days, he didn't sleep.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊以至七日，便作是念：「我今宜可以神足力，往詣迦毘羅衛國。」
translation: On the seventh day, the Bhagavān then thought, Now, it's appropriate for me to use my supernormal powers to go to Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊即將諸比丘，前後圍遶，往詣迦毘羅衛國。
translation: The Bhagavān then led the monks, surrounded by them in front and behind him, to Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 到已，便詣城北薩盧園中。
translation: On arriving there, he went to the Sadāparvata Grove north of the city.

source_sentence: 是時，真淨王聞世尊已達迦毘羅衛城北薩盧園中。
translation: At the time, King Zenshō had heard that the Bhagavān had arrived in the salu grove north of the city of Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 是時，真淨王將諸釋眾，往詣世尊所。
translation: The truly pure king then led the Śākyamunis to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊復作是念：「若真淨王躬自來者，此非我宜，我今當往與共相見。
translation: Again, the Bhagavān then had another thought, If the truly pure king came himself, this wouldn't be appropriate for me; I will now go and see him together.

source_sentence: 所以然者，父母恩重，育養情甚。」
translation: That's because their parents are so generous and nurturing with great affection.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊將諸比丘眾，往詣城門，飛在虛空，去地七仞。
translation: At that time the World-honored One, accompanied by a group of monks, approached the city gates and flew up into the sky seventy feet above the ground.

source_sentence: 是時，真淨王見世尊端政無比，世之希有，諸根寂靜，無眾多念，身有三十二相、八十種好，
translation: At that time, King Vimalakīrti saw the World-honored One’s incomparably handsome appearance, rare in the world. His faculties were tranquil and without much thought, and his body possessed the thirty-two eminent marks and eighty kinds of beauty.

source_sentence: 而自莊身，發歡喜之心，即便頭面禮足，而作是說：「我是剎利王種，
translation: They adorned themselves with joy and bowed their foreheads and feet, saying, “We are the royal family of the kṣatriyas.

source_sentence: 名曰真淨王。」
translation: He's called the king of true purity.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「令大王享壽無窮。
translation: The Bhagavān told him, So that the great king's longevity will be limitless.

source_sentence: 是故，大王！
translation: Therefore, great king!

source_sentence: 當以正法治化，勿用邪法。
translation: You should correctly rule and transform people according to the Dharma and not use false teachings.

source_sentence: 大王當知，諸有用正法治化者，身壞命終，生善處天上。」
translation: Great king, you should know that those who correctly rule and transform themselves will be born in a good place up in heaven when their bodies disintegrate and their lives end.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊即空中行，至真淨王宮中。
translation: The Bhagavān then flew up into the air and arrived at the palace of the truly pure king.

source_sentence: 到已，就座而坐。
translation: When he arrived, he took his seat and sat down.

source_sentence: 時，王見世尊坐定，手自斟酌，行種種飲食，見世尊食竟，行淨水，更取一小座而聽經。
translation: Seeing the World-honored One seated in meditation, the king prepared food and drink with his own hands and ate various delicacies. When he saw that the World-honored One had finished eating, he poured water to purify his body and took a small seat to listen to the discourse.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊與真淨王漸說妙義，所謂論者：施論、戒論、生天之論，欲不淨行，
translation: At that time the World-honored One gradually taught the sublime doctrine to King Vimalakīrti:

source_sentence: 出要為樂。
translation: The essentials that are produced are happiness.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊見王心開意解，諸佛世尊常所說法，苦、習、盡、道，盡向王說。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān saw that the king's mind was enlightened by the Bhagavān, and the buddhas and world-honored ones always taught the Dharma of suffering, accumulation, cessation, and the path to the king in full.

source_sentence: 是時，真淨王即於座上，諸塵垢盡，得法眼淨。
translation: At that time, the king of true purity was seated on his throne. Having extinguished all the defilements, he attained purity of the Dharma eye.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊與王說法已，即從座起而去。
translation: After teaching the Dharma to the king, the Bhagavān rose from his seat and departed.

source_sentence: 是時，真淨王普集釋眾，而作是說：「諸沙門等，顏貌極醜，剎利之種，
translation: At that time, King Vimalakīrti had assembled the great assembly of the Śākyas and said thus: The śramaṇas and others have utterly ugly features. They belong to the kṣatriya class.

source_sentence: 將諸梵志眾，此非其宜；
translation: It would not be advisable for him to lead the assembly of brahmins.

source_sentence: 剎利釋種還得剎利眾，此乃為妙。」
translation: The Śāriputra family of the kṣatriyas will then return to the kṣatriya community, which is marvelous.

source_sentence: 諸釋報言：「如是，大王！
translation: The Śākyamunis replied, So it is, great king!

source_sentence: 如大王教，剎利還得剎利眾，此乃為妙。」
translation: As the great king teaches, the kṣatriyas return to the kṣatriya community, which is marvelous.

source_sentence: 是時，王告國中：「諸有兄弟二人，當取一人作道，其不爾者，當重謫罰。」
translation: The king then told the king of the country, There are two brothers who will take one person to make a path, and if they don't do so, they'll be severely punished.

source_sentence: 時，諸釋眾聞王教令：「諸有兄弟二人，當取一人為道，其不從教，當重謫罰。」
translation: The Śākyamunis then heard the king's instructions, saying, If there are two brothers who take one person for the path and don't follow it, they'll be severely punished.

source_sentence: 是時，提婆達兜釋種語阿難釋言：「真淨王今日有教：『諸有兄弟二人，
translation: At that time, the Śākya clan of Devadatta said to Ānanda:

source_sentence: 當分一人作道。』
translation: You will be divided into one person to make the path.'

source_sentence: 汝今出家學道，我當在家修治家業。」
translation: Now that you've renounced home and trained in the path, I will cultivate my family business at home.

source_sentence: 是時，阿難釋歡喜踊躍，報言：「如兄來教。」
translation: At that point, Ānanda and Śākyamuni rejoiced and jumped for joy, replied, Just as my brother taught me.

source_sentence: 是時，難陀釋語阿那律釋言：「真淨王有教：『其有兄弟二人者，當分一人作道，
translation: Then the Sakyan Nanda said to the venerable Anuruddha: The king of the gods has instructed us, saying: If you have two brothers, let one be divided into two.

source_sentence: 其不爾者，當重謫罰。』
translation: If he doesn't, he'll be severely punished.'

source_sentence: 汝今出家，我當在家。」
translation: Now that you leave home, I'll stay at home.

source_sentence: 是時，阿那律釋聞此語已，歡喜踊躍，不能自勝，報曰：「如是。
translation: After hearing these words, Aniruddha was overjoyed and jumped for joy, unable to control himself.

source_sentence: 如兄來教。」
translation: It's as my brother taught me.

source_sentence: 是時，真淨王將斛淨、叔淨釋、甘露釋，至世尊所。
translation: At the time, King Zenshō went to the Bhagavān's place with Kukkuṭika, Śākyamuni, and Amṛta.

source_sentence: 爾時，駕四馬之車，白車、白蓋，白馬駕之；
translation: At that time the king was riding in a carriage drawn by four kinds of horses: white carts, white canopies, and white horses.

source_sentence: 第二釋乘青車、青蓋，青馬駕之；
translation: The second is an explanation of how to ride a blue chariot or a blue canopy drawn by a blue horse.

source_sentence: 第三釋乘黃車、黃蓋，黃馬駕之；
translation: The third interpretation is that they ride in yellow carts and yellow canopies, which are driven by yellow horses.

source_sentence: 第四釋乘赤車、赤蓋，赤馬駕之。
translation: The fourth explains that he rides a red chariot, a red canopy, and a red horse to drive it.

source_sentence: 是時，諸釋有乘象者，有乘馬者，皆悉來集。
translation: At the time, all the Śākyas with elephant-mounted vehicles and those riding horses assembled.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊遙見真淨王將諸釋眾而來，告諸比丘：「汝等觀此釋眾，并觀真淨王眾。
translation: The Bhagavān then saw King Śubhavyūha coming from a distance with the Śākyamunis, and he told the monks, Observe these Śākyamunis and the king of truth and purity.

source_sentence: 比丘當知，三十三天出園觀時，亦如此法，無有異。」
translation: You should know, monks, that when the Trāyastriṃśa gods leave the garden to observe, it's likewise, with no difference.

source_sentence: 是時，阿難乘大白象、白衣、白蓋。
translation: At the time, Ānanda was riding a large white elephant, white robe, and white canopy.

source_sentence: 見已，告諸比丘：「汝等見此阿難釋乘白象、白衣不乎？」
translation: After seeing it, he told the monks, Do you see this Ānanda's explanation of riding white elephants and white robes?

source_sentence: 諸比丘對曰：「唯然，世尊！
translation: The monks replied, Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等見之。」
translation: We'll see it.

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「此人當出家學道，第一多聞，堪侍左右。
translation: The Buddha told the monk, This man will leave home and study the path. He is the most learned and capable of serving his aides.

source_sentence: 汝等見此阿那律不乎？」
translation: Do you see this Aniruddha?

source_sentence: 諸比丘對曰：「唯然，見之。」
translation: The monks replied, Yes, I see it.

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「此人當出家學道，天眼第一。」
translation: The Buddha told the monk, This person will leave home and train in the path, with the divine eye being the best.

source_sentence: 是時，真淨王及兄弟四人，并難陀、阿難，皆步進前，除去五好，至世尊所，
translation: At that time, King Vimalakīrti and his four brothers, together with Nanda and Ānanda, proceeded on foot to the place where the World-honored One was. Removing their five good deeds, they came before the World-honored One.

source_sentence: 頭面禮足，在一面坐。
translation: They bowed their heads and feet at each other’s feet and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，真淨王白佛言：「昨日夜生此念：『剎利之眾不應將梵志眾，還將剎利眾，
translation: It was then that King Śubhavyūha said to the Buddha: Yesterday and night, I had this thought:

source_sentence: 此是其宜。』
translation: This is appropriate for him.'

source_sentence: 我便告令國中：『諸有兄弟二人者，便取一人，使出家學道。』
translation: I then told the emperor in my country, 'If there are two brothers, they'll take one of them and make him leave home to study the path.'

source_sentence: 唯願世尊聽出家學道。」
translation: May the Bhagavān only allow him to leave home and train in the path.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「善哉！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Good!

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 多所饒益，天、人得安。
translation: Many benefits will be provided, and gods and humans will attain peace.

source_sentence: 所以然者，此善知識良祐福田，我亦緣善知識，得脫此生、老、病、死。」
translation: That's why this good teacher is a good field of blessedness, and because of that good teacher, I too am able to be freed from this birth, old age, illness, and death.

source_sentence: 是時，諸釋眾便得為道。
translation: At that point, the Śākyamunis then attained the path.

source_sentence: 是時，真淨王白世尊曰：「唯願世尊教誨此新比丘，當如教誨優陀耶！
translation: King Zenshō then said to the Bhagavān, May the Bhagavān teach this new monk, and he will do as he teaches, Udayana!

source_sentence: 所以然者，此優陀耶比丘極有神力。
translation: That's because this monk Udayana has great supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 願優陀耶比丘恒在宮中教化，使眾生之類，長夜獲安隱。
translation: May the monk Udayana always be in the palace teaching and edifying, so that all sentient beings will attain peace for a long time to come.

source_sentence: 所以然者，此比丘極有神力，我初見優陀耶比丘，便發歡喜之心。
translation: The reason is that this monk has great supernormal powers. When I first saw the monk Udayana, I became delighted.

source_sentence: 我便作此念：『弟子尚有神力，況彼如來而無此神力乎？』」
translation: I then thought, 'That disciple still has supernormal powers, so why wouldn't the Tathāgata have these supernormal powers?'

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「如是，大王！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, So it is, great king!

source_sentence: 如大王教，此優陀耶比丘極有神力，有大威德。」
translation: As the great king teaches, this monk Udayana has great supernormal powers and great authority.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘：「第一弟子，博識多知，國王所念，所謂阿若拘鄰比丘是。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān addressed the monks, The first disciple was so learned and well known that the king thought of him as Ājñāta Kauṇḍinya Bhikṣu.

source_sentence: 能勸化人民，優陀耶比丘是。
translation: The monk who can encourage the people is the monk Udayana.

source_sentence: 有速疾智，所謂摩訶男比丘是。
translation: With quick knowledge, he's called the Mahāprajñāpāramitā monk.

source_sentence: 恒喜飛行，所謂須婆休比丘是。
translation: He always liked flying, which was called the monk Suppository.

source_sentence: 空中往來，所謂婆破比丘是。
translation: The so-called monk Upagupta was the one who came and went in the sky.

source_sentence: 多諸弟子，所謂優毘迦葉比丘是。
translation: Many of his disciples called him Upikaśyapa Bhikṣu.

source_sentence: 意得觀空，所謂江迦葉比丘是。
translation: He had the intention to contemplate emptiness, which is called the monk Jiang Kāśyapa.

source_sentence: 意得止觀。
translation: The mind attains calmness and contemplation.

source_sentence: 所謂象迦葉比丘是。」
translation: This is the so-called elephant Kāśyapa monk.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊廣與真淨王說微妙之法。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān spoke extensively to King Śubhavyūha about the subtle Dharma.

source_sentence: 爾時，王聞法已，即從坐起，頭面禮足，便退而去。
translation: After hearing the teaching, the king rose from his seat, bowed his head and feet, withdrew, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，諸比丘及真淨王聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: At that time, having heard the Buddha’s discourse, the monks and the true and pure kings were delighted and remembered it well.
